tit.e: Kokutetsu (Japan National Railways (JNR))) Steam Locomotive Type 120
Kokutetsu (Japan National Railways (JNR)) Steam Locomotive Type 120
Kokutetsu (Japan National Railways (JNR)) Steam Locomotive Type 120

sen.j: 120形は、1874年（明治7年）、阪神間の鉄道開業に際してイギリスから輸入された蒸気機関車である。
sen.e: Type 120 was a steam locomotive which was imported from U.K in 1874 when a railway began operation between Osaka and Kobe.
Type 120 was a steam locomotive that was imported from U.K in 1874 when a railway began operation between Osaka and Kobe.
Type 120 was a steam locomotive that was imported from U.K. in 1874 when a railway began operation between Osaka and Kobe.

sen.j: 4両が輸入された。
sen.e: Four locomotives of this type were imported.
Four locomotives of this type were imported.
Four locomotives of this type were imported.

sen.j: 1873年（明治6年）、ロバート・スティーブンソン社(wenRobert Stephenson and Company)製（製造番号2102～2105）である。
sen.e: They were manufactured in 1873 by Robert Stephenson and Company (manufacturer's serial number 2102-2105).
They were manufactured in 1873 by Robert Stephenson and Company (manufacturer's serial number 2102-2105).
They were manufactured in 1873 by Robert Stephenson and Company (manufacturer's serial number 2102-2105).

sen.j: ロバート・スティーブンソン社製の蒸気機関車は、日本では本形式と台湾総督府鉄道に納入された鉄道作業局国鉄400形蒸気機関車と同形の2両のみで、希少な存在である。
sen.e: Of steam locomotives manufactured by Robert Stephenson and Company, only these four and two of Kokutetsu Steam Locomotive Type 400, which belonged to Tetsudo Sagyokyoku (a government bureau in charge of railway) and were delivered to Taiwan Governor-General Railway, were imported into Japan, and therefore they have scarcity value.

Of steam locomotives manufactured by Robert Stephenson and Company, only these four and two Kokutetsu Steam Locomotives Type 400, belonging to Tetsudo Sagyokyoku (a government bureau in charge of the railway) delivered to Taiwan Governor-General Railway, were imported into Japan, and therefore they had rare value.

Of steam locomotives manufactured by Robert Stephenson and Company, only these four and two Kokutetsu Steam Locomotives Type 400, belonging to Tetsudo Sagyokyoku (a government bureau in charge of the railway) delivered to Taiwan Governor-General Railway, were imported into Japan, and therefore they had rare value.

sen.j: 本項では、1876年（明治9年）に輸入された同仕様のシャープ・スチュアート社(Sharp, Stewart Co. Ltd.,)製の4両（1875年製、製造番号2480～2483。後の130形、140形）についても記述する。
sen.e: This article also mentions about four locomotives of same specifications which were manufactured by Sharp, Stewart Co., Ltd. (manufactured in 1875, manufacturer's serial number 2480-2483, later called Type 130 and Type140) and were imported in 1876.

This article also mentions four locomotives of the same specifications manufactured by Sharp, Stewart Co., Ltd. (manufactured in 1875, serial number 2480-2483, later called Type 130 and Type140) were imported in 1876.

This article also mentions four locomotives of the same specifications manufactured by Sharp, Stewart Co., Ltd. (manufactured in 1875, serial number 2480-2483, later called Type 130 and Type140) were imported in 1876.

sen.j: 構造
sen.e: Structure
Structure
Structure
Type 120
Type 120
Type 120

sen.j: 動輪直径は1295mm(4ft3in)、車軸配置2-4-0(1B)で2気筒単式の飽和式タンク機関車である。
sen.e: It is a tank locomotive with two cylinders that employs saturated steam system with simple expansion, and its driving wheel's diameter is 1295 mm (4 ft 3 in) and axle arrangement is 2-4-0.
It was a tank locomotive with two cylinders that employed a saturated steam system with simple expansion, and its driving wheel diameter was 1295 mm (4 ft 3 in) and axle arrangement was 2-4-0.
It was a tank locomotive with two cylinders that employed a saturated steam system with simple expansion, and its driving wheel diameter was 1295 mm (4 ft 3 in) and axle arrangement was 2-4-0 (1B).

sen.j: 弁装置はスチーブンソン式弁装置、安全弁はサルター式で、蒸気ドームがボイラー上に設けられている。
sen.e: Its valve gear is Stephenson valve gear, its safety valve is Salter valve, and its steam dome is set on top of a boiler.
Its incorporated a Stephenson valve gear, a Salter safety valve, and its steam dome was set on top of a boiler.
It incorporated a Stephenson valve gear, a Salter safety valve, and its steam dome was set on top of a boiler.

sen.j: 運転台は、前面のみに風除けが設けられており、屋根は後方にある2本の鋼管で支持され、側方、後方は開放式となっている。
sen.e: As for driver's platform, a windshield is set only in front, a roof is supported by two steel pipes located on the rear part and the sides and the backside are open.
For the driver's platform, a windshield is set only in front, a roof is supported by two steel pipes located in the rear and the sides and the backside are open.
For the driver's platform, a windshield is set only in front, a roof is supported by two steel pipes located in the rear and the sides and the backside are open.

sen.j: 側水槽、炭庫などには沈み鋲を多用しており、平滑な表面が特徴的である。
sen.e: As its side water tank and coal storage box were fixed mainly with flush rivets, its smooth surface is characteristic.
As the side water tank and coal storage box were fixed mainly with flush rivets, its smooth surface is characteristic of this model.
As the side water tank and coal storage box were fixed mainly with flush rivets, its smooth surface is characteristic of this model.

sen.j: 1890年代の終わりごろ、新橋工場で改造が行われ、開放的だった運転室には側方、後方に風除けが設けられた。
sen.e: It was altered at Shinbashi Work around the end of 1890's, and windshields were installed on the sides and back of driver's platform.
It was altered at Shinbashi Works around the end of 1890's, and windshields were installed on the sides and behind the driver's platform.
It was altered at Shinbashi Works around the end of 1890's, and windshields were installed on the sides and behind the driver's platform.

sen.j: 安全弁もラムズボトム式に変更された。
sen.e: At the same time, its safety valves were replaced by those of Ramsbottom type.
At the same time, the safety valves were replaced with Ramsbottom type valves.
At the same time, the safety valves were replaced with Ramsbottom type valves.

sen.j: また、蒸気ドームも前方に移設されている。
sen.e: Also, its steam dome was moved to the front part.
Also, its steam dome was moved to the front part.
Also, its steam dome was moved to the front part.

sen.j: 1両(8)は、側水槽を前方に延長し、砂撒き装置を作り替えている。
sen.e: For one of them (8), its side water tank was extended forward and the sanding machine was revamped.
For one of them (eight), its side water tank was extended forward and the sanding machine was revamped.
For one of them (eight), its side water tank was extended forward and the sanding machine was revamped.

Type 130 and Type 140
Type 130 and Type 140
Type 130 and Type 140

sen.j: 主要寸法は、スティーブンソン製と同一であるが、通常の鋲（リベット）によって組み立てられているため、側水槽などに鋲頭が目立つのが相違点である。
sen.e: Although their sizes are basically same with those of Stephenson products, nailheads are seen on the side water tank since they were assembled using ordinary rivets.
Although their sizes are basically the same as those of Stephenson products, nailheads are seen on the side water tanks since they were assembled using ordinary rivets.
Although their sizes are basically the same as those of Stephenson products, nailheads are seen on the side water tanks since they were assembled using ordinary rivets.

sen.j: 2両は1882年（明治15年）に日本鉄道に譲渡されたが、官設鉄道に残った2両（後の130形）はスティーブンソン製よりもやや遅く改装が施された。
sen.e: Two locomotives were sold to Nihon Railway in 1882, and other two, which were continuously used by the government-managed railway (later called Type 130), were also altered a little later after Stephenson products were altered.

Two locomotives were sold to Nihon Railway in 1882, and two others, which were continuously used by the government-managed railway (later called Type 130), were also altered a little later after Stephenson products were altered.

Two locomotives were sold to Nihon Railway in 1882, and two others, which were continuously used by the government-managed railway (later called Type 130), were also altered a little later after Stephenson products were altered.

sen.j: 日本鉄道に譲渡された2両（後の140形）は、鉄道国有法まで原型に近い形態を保っていた。
sen.e: Two locomotives that were sold to Nihon Railway (later called Type 140) kept their original shape until the time when the company was nationalized based on the Railway Nationalization Act.
Two locomotives that were sold to Nihon Railway (later called Type 140) kept their original configuration until the time when the company was nationalized based upon the Railway Nationalization Act.
Two locomotives that were sold to Nihon Railway (later called Type 140) kept their original configuration until the time when the company was nationalized based upon the Railway Nationalization Act.

sen.j: 運転・経歴
sen.e: Operation and history
Operation and history
Operation and history

sen.j: 1874年に来着したスティーブンソン製の4両は、西部地区（神戸）に配属された。
sen.e: Four locomotives manufactured by Stephenson arrived in 1874 and were assigned to Western Japan (Kobe).
Four locomotives manufactured by Stephenson arrived in 1874 and were assigned to Western Japan (Kobe).
Four locomotives manufactured by Stephenson arrived in 1874 and were assigned to Western Japan (Kobe).

sen.j: 当初はシャープ・スチュアート製テンダー機関車（後の国鉄5000形蒸気機関車）の続番である「13～16」と付番されたと思われるが、それを証明する資料は未発見である。
sen.e: It seems that they were numbered "No.13-No.16", consecutive numbers from those of tendar locomotives manufactured by Sharp, Stewart Co., Ltd. (later called Kokutetsu Steam Locomotive Type 5000), but no material has been found to prove it.

It seems that they were numbered "No.13-No.16," consecutive numbers from tender locomotives manufactured by Sharp, Stewart Co., Ltd. (later called Kokutetsu Steam Locomotive Type 5000), but no recorded material has been found to confirm it.

It seems that they were numbered 'No.13-No.16,' consecutive numbers from tender locomotives manufactured by Sharp, Stewart Co., Ltd. (later called Kokutetsu Steam Locomotive Type 5000), but no recorded material has been found to confirm it.

sen.j: 1875年には、シャープ・スチュアート製の増備車4両が来着し、「24～27」と付番されたと思われる。
sen.e: Another four locomotives manufactured by Sharp, Stewart Co., Ltd. arrived in 1875, and it is considered that they were numbered "No. 24-No. 27".
Another four locomotives manufactured by Sharp, Stewart Co., Ltd. arrived in 1875, and it is anticipated that they were numbered "No. 24-No. 27."
Another four locomotives manufactured by Sharp, Stewart Co., Ltd. arrived in 1875, and it is anticipated that they were numbered 'No. 24-No. 27.'

sen.j: 1876年（明治9年）には、東部（京浜間）の機関車を奇数に、西部（阪神間）の機関車を偶数とする改番が実施された。
sen.e: In 1876, a new numbering system was introduced under which odd numbers were used for locomotives used in East Japan (between Tokyo and Yokohama) and even numbers were used for locomotives used in West Japan (between Osaka and Kobe).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: In 1876, a new numbering system was introduced under which odd numbers were used for locomotives used in Eastern Japan (between Tokyo and Yokohama) and even numbers were used for locomotives used in Western Japan (between Osaka and Kobe).

In 1876, a new numbering system was introduced under which odd numbers were used for locomotives used in Eastern Japan (between Tokyo and Yokohama) and even numbers were used for locomotives used in Western Japan (between Osaka and Kobe).
As a result, No. 13-No.16 were canged to "No.6, No.8, No.10 and No.12" and No.24-No. 27 were changed to "No.34, No.36, No.38 and No. 40" respectively.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: As a result, No. 13-No.16 were changed to "No.6, No.8, No.10 and No.12" and No.24-No. 27 were changed to "No.34, No.36, No.38 and No. 40" respectively.
As a result, No. 13 - No. 16 were changed to 'No. 6, No. 8, No. 10 and No. 12' and No. 24 - No. 27 were changed to 'No. 34, No. 36, No. 38 and No. 40' respectively.

sen.j: シャープ・スチュアート製の2両（36，40）は、前述のように1882年に日本鉄道に譲渡され、同社のSS2/3形（16，17）となった。
sen.e: As mentioned above, two locomotives manufactured by Sharp, Stewart Co., Ltd. (36 and 40) were sold to Nihon Railway in 1882 and became its Type SS2/3 (16 and 17).
As mentioned above, two locomotives manufactured by Sharp, Stewart Co., Ltd. (36 and 40) were sold to Nihon Railway in 1882 and were known as Type SS2/3 (16 and 17).
As mentioned above, two locomotives manufactured by Sharp, Stewart Co., Ltd. (36 and 40) were sold to Nihon Railway in 1882 and were known as Type SS2/3 (16 and 17).

sen.j: 官設鉄道に残った34，38は、そのまま西部地区で使用されていたが、後（1890年頃？）に東部地区に転属。
sen.e: No. 34 and No. 38, which were continuously used by the government-managed railway, were used in West Japan as they were, but later (around 1890 ?) they were transferred to East Japan.
No. 34 and No. 38, which were continuously used by the government-managed railway, were used in Western Japan as they were, but later (around 1890 ?) they were transferred to Eastern Japan.
No. 34 and No. 38, which were continuously used by the government-managed railway, were used in Western Japan as they were, but later (around 1890 ?) they were transferred to Eastern Japan.

sen.j: スティーブンソン製の4両についても、1884年から1885年にかけて東部地区に転属し、京浜間で使用された。
sen.e: Four locomotives manufactured by Stephenson were also transferred to East Japan during 1884 to 1885 and were used for the line connecting Tokyo and Yokohama.
Four locomotives manufactured by Stephenson were also transferred to Eastern Japan during 1884 to 1885 and were used on the line connecting Tokyo and Yokohama.
Four locomotives manufactured by Stephenson were also transferred to Eastern Japan during 1884 to 1885 and were used on the line connecting Tokyo and Yokohama.

sen.j: 1894年（明治27年）には、スティーブンソン製の4両はF形に、シャープ・スチュアート製はG形に類別された。
sen.e: In 1894, four locomotives manufactured by Stephenson were classified as Type F and locomotives manufactured by Sharp, Stewart Co., Ltd. were classified as Type G.
In 1894, four locomotives manufactured by Stephenson were classified as Type F and locomotives manufactured by Sharp, Stewart Co., Ltd. were classified as Type G.
In 1894, four locomotives manufactured by Stephenson were classified as Type F and locomotives manufactured by Sharp, Stewart Co., Ltd. were classified as Type G.

sen.j: その際、シャープ・スチュアート製は、34は31に、38は32に改番されている。
sen.e: On this occasion, the numbers of locomotives manufactured by Sharp, Stewart Co., Ltd. were changed, namely No. 34 was changed to No.31 and No. 38 was changed to No. 32.
On this occasion, the numbers of locomotives manufactured by Sharp, Stewart Co., Ltd. were changed, namely No. 34 was changed to No.31 and No. 38 was changed to No. 32.
On this occasion, the numbers of locomotives manufactured by Sharp, Stewart Co., Ltd. were changed, namely No. 34 was changed to No. 31 and No. 38 was changed to No. 32.

sen.j: 1898年（明治31年）の鉄道作業局による分類では、両形式を統合してA4形となっている。
sen.e: According to the classification made by Tetsudo Gagyokyoku in 1898, both types were integrated into Type A 4.
According to the classification made by Tetsudo Gagyokyoku in 1898, both types were integrated into Type A 4.
According to the classification made by Tetsudo Sagyokyoku in 1898, both types were integrated into Type A 4.

sen.j: 1906年（明治39年）に制定された鉄道国有法により、日本鉄道は買収・国有化され、同社に分かれていた2両は、再び官設鉄道に戻った。
sen.e: Nihon Railway was purchased by the nation and nationalized after the Railway Nationalization Act was enacted in 1906, and two locomotives belonged to it returned to the government-managed railway.

Nihon Railway was purchased by the nation and nationalized after the Railway Nationalization Act was enacted in 1906, and two locomotives belonging to it were returned to the government-managed railway.

Nihon Railway was purchased by the nation and nationalized after the Railway Nationalization Act was enacted in 1906, and two locomotives belonging to it were returned to the government-managed railway.

sen.j: この買収を受けて1909年（明治42年）に制定された鉄道院の形式称号規程では、スティーブンソン製の4両は120形（120～123）に改められている。
sen.e: According to "Regulations on Types and Classification", which was established by Tetsudo-In (the predecessor of the Ministry of Railway) in 1909 after its purcahse of Nihon Tetsudo, four locomotives manufactured by Stephenson were classified as Type 120 (No. 120-No. 123).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: According to "Regulations on Types and Classification," established by Tetsudo-In (the predecessor of the Ministry of Railway) in 1909 after its purcahse of Nihon Tetsudo, four locomotives manufactured by Stephenson were classified as Type 120 (No. 120-No. 123).

According to "Regulations on Types and Classification," established by Tetsudo-In (the predecessor of the Ministry of Railway) in 1909 after its purchase of Nihon Tetsudo, four locomotives manufactured by Stephenson were classified as Type 120 (No. 120 - No. 123).

sen.j: また、シャープ・スチュアート製のうち官設鉄道にとどまっていた2両は130形（130，131）に、日本鉄道から戻った2両は140形（140，141）に改められている。
sen.e: As for locomotives manufactured by Sharp, Stewart Co., Ltd., two locomotives belonged to the government-managed railway were classified as Type 130 (No. 131 and No. 132), and other two locomotives which once belonged to Nihon Railway were classified as Type 140 (No. 140 and No. 141).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: As for locomotives manufactured by Sharp, Stewart Co., Ltd., two locomotives belonged to the government-managed railway were classified as Type 130 (No. 131 and No. 132), and two other locomotives once belonging to Nihon Railway were classified as Type 140 (No. 140 and No. 141).

As for locomotives manufactured by Sharp, Stewart Co., Ltd., two locomotives belonged to the government-managed railway were classified as Type 130 (No. 131 and No. 132), and two other locomotives once belonging to Nihon Railway were classified as Type 140 (No. 140 and No. 141).

sen.j: その後、数年のうちに本グループは淘汰の対象となり、1912年（明治45年）から1915年（大正4年）にかけて、地方私鉄などに譲渡された。
sen.e: Thereafter, these locomotives became the target of disposal and were sold to local private railways during the period from 1912 to 1915.
Thereafter, these locomotives became the target of disposal and were sold to local private railways during 1912 to 1915.
Thereafter, these locomotives became the target of disposal and were sold to local private railways during 1912 to 1915.

sen.j: 譲渡後も私鉄の間を転々としたものが多く、中にはその私鉄の国有化によって、再度あるいは三度も国有鉄道に籍を移したものがある。
sen.e: Many of them drifted from company to company after they were sold, and some of them were registered at Japan National Railway twice or three times due to the nationalization of private railways to which they belonged.

Many of them drifted from company to company after they were sold, and some of them were registered at Japan National Railway two or three times due to the nationalization of private railways to which they belonged.

Many of them drifted from company to company after they were sold, and some of them were registered at Japan National Railway two or three times due to the nationalization of private railways to which they belonged.

sen.j: 移籍の状況については、次のとおりである。
sen.e: History of the transfer of locomotives are shown below.
History of the transfer of locomotives is shown below.
History of the transfer of locomotives is shown below.

sen.j: 120と122は、1914年（大正3年）5月に三河鉄道（現在の名古屋鉄道名鉄三河線）に払下げられ、鉄道院時代の番号のまま使用された。
sen.e: No. 120 and No. 122 were sold in May 1914 to Mikawa Railway (currently, the Meitetsu Mikawa Line of Nagoya Railroad Co., Ltd.), and they were used under the same number with those of Tetsudo-in.
No. 120 and No. 122 were sold in May 1914 to Mikawa Railway (currently, the Meitetsu Mikawa Line of Nagoya Railroad Co., Ltd.), and they were used under the same number with those of Tetsudo-in.
No. 120 and No. 122 were sold in May 1914 to Mikawa Railway (currently, the Meitetsu Mikawa Line of Nagoya Railroad Co., Ltd.), and they were used under the same number with those of Tetsudo-in.

sen.j: 1925年（大正14年）に同鉄道の鉄道の電化により休車となり、1934年（昭和9年）ごろ解体された。
sen.e: Their use was suspended when the company's line was electrified in 1925, and they were scrapped around in 1934.
Their use was suspended when the company line was electrified in 1925, and they were scrapped in 1934.
Their use was suspended when the company line was electrified in 1925, and they were scrapped in 1934.

sen.j: 121と123は、1915年3月に簸上鉄道（現在の西日本旅客鉄道木次線の一部）に払下げられ、同社の1，2となった。
sen.e: 121 and 123 were sold in March 1915 to Hinokami Railway (currently, a part of the Kisuki Line of West Japan Railway Company), and they became No. 1 and No. 2 of the company.
Locomotives number 121 and 123 were sold in March 1915 to Hinokami Railway (currently, a part of the Kisuki Line of West Japan Railway Company), and they became No. 1 and No. 2 in the company.
Locomotives number 121 and 123 were sold in March 1915 to Hinokami Railway (currently, a part of the Kisuki Line of West Japan Railway Company), and they became No. 1 and No. 2 in the company.

sen.j: そのうちの2は、1926年（大正15年）に加悦鉄道に譲渡された。
sen.e: Out of them, No. 2 was sold in 1926 to Kaetsu Railway,
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Of these, No. 2 was sold in 1926 to Kaetsu Railway,
Of these, No. 2 was sold in 1926 to Kaetsu Railway,

sen.j: 1は1934年（昭和9年）8月の簸上鉄道国有化により、再び国有鉄道（鉄道省）籍に戻り、帳簿上は旧番の121に復したが、翌1935年（昭和10年）には、南総鉄道に再び譲渡され、同社の1となった。
sen.e: On the other hand, No. 1 was again registered in August 1934 at Japan National Railways (Ministry of Railways) under the former number 121 because of the nationalization of Hinokami Railway, but it was again sold to Nanso Railway in 1935 and became No. 1 of the company.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: On the other hand, No. 1 was again registered in August 1934 at Japan National Railways (Ministry of Railways) under the former number 121 because of the nationalization of Hinokami Railway, but it was again sold to Nanso Railway in 1935 and became No. 1 in the company.

On the other hand, No. 1 was again registered in August 1934 at Japan National Railways (Ministry of Railways) under the former number 121 because of the nationalization of Hinokami Railway, but it was again sold to Nanso Railway in 1935 and became No. 1 in the company.

sen.j: しかし、南総鉄道は1939年（昭和14年）に廃止され、その後の消息は不明になっている。
sen.e: However, no information is available after Nanso Railway was abolished in 1939.
However, no information was found available after Nanso Railway was abolished in 1939.
However, no information was found after Nanso Railway was abolished in 1939.

sen.j: 130と140は、1913年（大正2年）に宮崎県営鉄道（現在の九州旅客鉄道日豊本線及び妻線の一部）に払下げられ、鉄道院時代の番号のまま使用された。
sen.e: No. 130 and No. 140 were sold in 1913 to Miyazaki Prefectural Railway (currently, a part of the Nippo Main Line and the Tsuma line of Kysuu Railway Company), and they were used under the same number with those of Tetsudo-In.

No. 130 and No. 140 were sold in 1913 to Miyazaki Prefectural Railway (currently, a part of the Nippo Main Line and the Tsuma line of Kysuu Railway Company), and they were used under the same number as those of Tetsudo-In.

No. 130 and No. 140 were sold in 1913 to Miyazaki Prefectural Railway (currently, a part of the Nippo Main Line and the Tsuma line of Kyushu Railway Company), and they were used under the same number as those of Tetsudo-In.

sen.j: 1917年（大正6年）9月に宮崎県営鉄道は国有化され、両機は再び国有鉄道籍に戻った。
sen.e: They were again registered at Japan National Railway in September 1917 when Miyazaki Prefectural Railway was nationalized.
They were again registered by the Japan National Railway in September 1917 when Miyazaki Prefectural Railway was nationalized.
They were again registered by the Japan National Railway in September 1917 when Miyazaki Prefectural Railway was nationalized.

sen.j: 130は、1919年（大正8年）に防石鉄道に譲渡され、旧番号のまま使用された。
sen.e: No. 130 was sold in 1919 to Boseki Railway and used under the same number with that of Tetsudo-In.
No. 130 was sold in 1919 to Boseki Railway and used under the same number as that of Tetsudo-In.
No. 130 was sold in 1919 to Boseki Railway and used under the same number as that of Tetsudo-In.

sen.j: 同機は1940年（昭和15年）に台湾に売却されたが、その後の消息は不明である。
sen.e: It was sold to Taiwan in 1940 and nothing has been heard since then.
It was sold to Taiwan in 1940 and nothing has been heard about it since then.
It was sold to Taiwan in 1940 and nothing has been heard about it since then.

sen.j: 一方140は、1922年（大正11年）に阿南鉄道（現在の四国旅客鉄道牟岐線の一部）に譲渡され、旧番号のまま使用された。
sen.e: On the other hand, No. 140 was sold in 1922 to Anan Railway (currently, a part of the Mugu Line of Shikoku Railway Company) and was used under the former number.
On the other hand, No. 140 was sold in 1922 to Anan Railway (currently, a part of the Mugu Line of Shikoku Railway Company) and was used under the former number.
On the other hand, No. 140 was sold in 1922 to Anan Railway (currently, a part of the Mugu Line of Shikoku Railway Company) and was used under the former number.

sen.j: 阿南鉄道も1936年（昭和11年）7月に国有化され、同機は三度国有鉄道籍に戻った。
sen.e: As Anan Railway was nationalized in July 1936, it was registered at Japan National Railway for the third time.
As Anan Railway was nationalized in July 1936, it was registered by Japan National Railway for the third time.
As Anan Railway was nationalized in July 1936, it was registered by Japan National Railway for the third time.

sen.j: 再々買収後の1940年に越中鉄道（後の富山地方鉄道射水線及び現在の万葉線新湊港線）に譲渡された。
sen.e: In 1940, after it was registered at Japan National Railway for the third time, it was sold to Ecchu Railway (it later became the Toyama Chiho Tetsudo Imizu Line of Toyama ChihoTetsudo Inc. and the current Manyo Line Manyo Line Shinminatoko Line).

In 1940, after it was registered by the Japan National Railway for the third time, it was sold to Ecchu Railway (it later became the Toyama Chiho Tetsudo Imizu Line of Toyama Chiho Tetsudo Inc. and the current Manyo Line Manyo Line Shinminatoko Line).

In 1940, after it was registered by the Japan National Railway for the third time, it was sold to Ecchu Railway (it later became the Imizu Line of Toyama Chiho Tetsudo Inc. and the current Manyo Line Shinminatoko Line).

sen.j: 1942年（昭和17年）に東北本線村崎野駅にあった東北化学肥料専用線に売却され、1952年（昭和27年）まで使用された。
sen.e: It was sold in 1942 to Tohoku Chemical's fertilizer private siding located at Murasakino Station of the Tohoku Main Line and was used until 1952.
It was sold in 1942 to Tohoku Chemical's fertilizer private side located at Murasakino Station of the Tohoku Main Line and was used until 1952.
It was sold in 1942 to Tohoku Chemical's fertilizer private side located at Murasakino Station of the Tohoku Main Line and was used until 1952.

sen.j: 131と141については、1912年3月に内務省 (日本)土木局に保管転換され、直轄河川の工事用に使用されたが、詳細は不明である。
sen.e: No. 131 and No. 141 were transferred to the Engineering Burau of Interior Ministry and used for the construction work of government-administered rivers, but the details are unknown.
No. 131 and No. 141 were transferred to the Engineering Burau of the Interior Ministry and used for construction work of government-administered rivers, but the details are unknown.
No. 131 and No. 141 were transferred to the Engineering Bureau of the Interior Ministry in March 1912 and used for construction work of government-administered rivers, but the details are unknown.

sen.j: 保存
sen.e: Preservation
Preservation
Preservation

sen.j: 加悦鉄道に譲渡された1両（2号蒸気機関車。旧123号）が、京都府与謝郡与謝野町の「加悦SL広場」に静態保存されている。
sen.e: One locomotive which was sold to Kaetsu Railway (No.2 steam locomotive. Former No. 123) is being preserved at "Kaetsu Steam Locomotive Square" located in Yosano-cho, Yosano-gun, Kyoto Prefecture.
One locomotive sold to Kaetsu Railway (No.2 steam locomotive. Former No. 123) is being preserved at "Kaetsu Steam Locomotive Square" located in Yosano-cho, Yosano-gun, Kyoto Prefecture.
One locomotive sold to Kaetsu Railway (No. 2 steam locomotive. Former No. 123) is being preserved at 'Kaetsu Steam Locomotive Square' located in Yosano-cho, Yosano-gun, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 同機は、2005年（平成17年）6月9日、その機関車台帳とともに国の重要文化財に指定された。
sen.e: It was designated, together with its locomotive registry, as national important cultural properties as of June 9, 2005.
It was designated, together with its locomotive registry, as a national important cultural property as of June 9, 2005.
It was designated, together with its locomotive registry, as a national important cultural property as of June 9, 2005.
